snippet: When adjusted for changes in consumer prices, the Dow Jones industrial average remains nearly 10 percent below the nominal record set in 2007, but the real peak was in 2000.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off the Charts column notes that Dow Jones industrial average has recovered all ground lost in recession and has risen to new highs.
lead_paragraph: When adjusted for changes in consumer prices, the Dow Jones industrial average remains nearly 10 percent below the nominal record set in 2007, but the real peak was in 2000.

headline.print_headline: A Long Road Back for the Dow Industrials
headline.seo: Dow Index Sets New High, but Not With Inflation
headline.main: A Long Road Back for the Dow Industrials
